meanings.definition: To draw back or tense the body, as from pain or from a blow; start; flinch.
meanings.sent1: She was wincing as the dentist approached with the needle.
meanings.sent2: He kept wincing every time the cold wind hit his face.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept wincing playfully whenever it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to be wincing under the weight of the heavy snow on its roof.
meanings.sent5: The actor's realistic wincing made the audience cringe in sympathy.

meanings.definition: To shrink or start involuntarily, as in pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: The child was wincing in fear at the sight of the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help wincing when she touched the hot stove accidentally.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated wincing at the bad joke made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden were wincing under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's wincing after the fall showed the intensity of the pain.
